intro: Verbena parvula, commonly known as smallflower verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has narrow, opposite leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Verbena parvula is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
